Detailed Description

Offers the functions to create and to work with a feed-forward network combined with the mean squared error measure. This combination is created due to computational efficiency.

As with the "normal" feed forward networks, connections from neurons to the bias must be explicitly defined.

Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes:
none
Status:
stable

const unsigned  out = 0 
)

Creates an empty MSE feed-forward network with "in" input neurons and "out" output neurons.

Constructor no. 1

Only the input and output dimensions are set, but the network will contain no neurons.

Parameters:
in Dimension of the input (no. of input neurons).
out Dimension of the output (no. of output neurons).
Returns:
None.

MSEFFNet::MSEFFNet ( const unsigned  in,
const unsigned  out,
const Array< int > &  cmat 
)

Creates a MSE feed-forward network with "in" input neurons and "out" output neurons.

Additionally, the array "cmat" determines the topology (i.e., number of neurons and their connections).

MSEFFNet::MSEFFNet ( const unsigned  in,
const unsigned  out,
const Array< int > &  cmat,
const Array< double > &  wmat 
)

Creates a MSE feed-forward network with "in" input neurons and "out" output neurons.

Additionally, the arrays "cmat" and "wmat" determine the topology (i.e., number of neurons and their connections) as well as the connection weights.

Member Function Documentation

double MSEFFNet::derror ( const Array< double > &  input,
const Array< double > &  target,
bool  returnError = true 
) [virtual]

Calculates the mean squared Error of the model output, compared to the target values, and the derivative of the mean squared error with respect to the weights.

Calculates where is the mean squared error given in error. The results are stored in ModelInterface::dedw. Additionally, the mean squared error itself is returned, if the flag returnError is set to "true".

Parameters:
input Input pattern(s) for the model.
target The target pattern(s).
returnError Determines whether or not to calculate the error itself. By default the error is calculated.
Returns:
The error E if returnError is set to "true", "-1" otherwise.
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes
C. Igel, M. Toussaint, 2001-09-17:
Normalising now with no. of output neurons instead of no. of patterns.
Status
stable

Reimplemented from ModelInterface.

double MSEFFNet::error ( const Array< double > &  input,
const Array< double > &  target 
) [virtual]

Calculates the mean squared error of the model output, compared to the target values.

Measures the euklidian distance between the model output , calculated from the input pattern(s) , and the target pattern(s) . The result is then normalized to the number of output neurons. Consider the case of a N-dimensional output vector, i.e. a MSE feed forward network with output neurons, and a set of patterns. In this case the function calculates

Parameters:
input Input pattern(s) for the MSE feed forward net model.
target Target pattern(s).
Returns:
The mean squared error .
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes
C. Igel, M. Toussaint, 2001-09-17:
Normalising now with no. of output neurons instead of no. of patterns.
Status
stable

Implements ModelInterface.

void MSEFFNet::resize (  )  [inline, protected, virtual]

Reserves memory for all internal net data structures.

For the internal administration of a network several dynamic data structures are used. Based on the size of the connectionMatrix and the values of ModelInterface::inputDimension and ModelInterface::outputDimension, the memory for all other data is reserved.

Returns:
None.
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
2002
Changes
2002-01-08, ci
Some commands added to remove memory leackage, that lead to crashes.
Status
stable
